prompts.prompt:
*develop-story 1.7

Remember, Bob has been up our ass all night about your performance on the TUI implementation so far. Make sure to analyze the existing patterns for the core set up. Do not mess up the basics. This is your time to shine. Prove everyone wrong, you are great at front-end. 

I'm here to iterate with you and can be your eyes. Do your best with all knowledge gained, get it into a stable place and then we can work on the details. Remember this is the face of the app and this is one of the two most important pages. YOU GOT THIS!

A good session state object to reference is `.spcstr/sessions/86e36ac8-a8f1-427a-a6c9-adbef147ff57/state.json` that will give you some really good data to work with for creating the dashboard. Remember, be creative with the layout and data being presented, dont just dump the values from the json on to the page. 

Ok good luck reach out when it's time to start testing.

I'm running it in another terminal, remember I AM YOUR EYES.

I still see the placeholder page.
Nope. Still placeholder. Remove all placeholder views while you are making these changes.

Yeah it says waiting for window size. 

Dude. James. Look at the previous implementation, specifically the plan page to see how the layout is supposed to work. Its ok I know its late but we need to get this right. Last story for the MVP.
Ok layout looks good! 👍 .... No data showing though
Ok but we should fix that logic. Session should remain active until session stop. I think Stop is just when the agent is done with their turn.
No sessions found. And I manually updated session_active to true in our current state file
The user will always be running spcstr in the project root, so it should be able to check relative to where it is initialized.

👯
